availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Trimble Handlin (Livingston County, KY, petitioner)

body.p: Livingston County, Kentucky, resident. Livingston County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joseph Handlin. Married to Rosa B. Clark Handlin in Livingston County, Kentucky, on February 15, 1859. Father of Clara Handlin. Attended school in Crittenden County in 1850. Signed a petition to Governor James F. Robinson on behalf of Albert Elmore in Livingston County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 213B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Smithland, p. 249B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994048, Livingston County Marriages, p. 231.
"I T Handlin (1832-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial 74612574, accessed March 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74612574.
KYR-0001-029-0172.
